heisig_chinese_memo: When mouths are around a table, one head is likely to say something controversial and start some hubbub.
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: What's all the hubbub about? There's four mouths munching away on a head over there!
humanum_full_description_en:
Bronze inscription from the four " mouths " from the " page " (with the head protruding like a human), the congregation's mouth is noisy (He Linyi). "Shuowen": "Xiao (嚻), the sound. The anger goes up. From 㗊, from the page. Page, the first also. 𠽸, clamor or province." "Guangyun": "Crowd, noisy." "Yu Chapter": "Noisy, noisy."

Bronze inscription is used as the original meaning to express noise. Zhongshan Wangding: "Do not be big and wanton, not rich but arrogant, not crowded." "Book of Rites. "Fang Ji": "Ziyun: "Poverty but happy, rich and good courtesy, people who are peaceful, the world has its own."" "People and peace" is in contrast to the inscription "No people but arrogant", It can be proved that "rallying without crowds" means not to gather crowds to make noise. "Zuo Zhuan. "Sixteenth Year of Cheng Gong": "In Chen and clamor, together and increase clamor." Du Yinan: "clamor, clamor."

Also used as a surname. It is also used as an official name. "Mo Xiao" means "Mo Ao", which is the official name of Chu State, namely Sima (see Zhou Shirong).
humanum_short_description_en: " Crowd " means noise in the congregation. The original meaning is noise.
humanum_full_description:
金文從四「口」從「頁」(象人形而突出頭部)，會眾口喧嘩之意(何琳儀)。《說文》：「囂(嚻)，聲也。气出頭上。从㗊、从頁。頁，首也。𠽸，囂或省。」《廣韻》：「囂，喧也。」《玉篇》：「囂，喧譁也。」

　　金文用作本義，表示喧嘩。中山王鼎：「毋大而肆，毋富而驕，毋眾而囂」。《禮記．坊記》：「子云：『貧而好樂，富而好禮，眾而以寧者，天下其幾矣。』」「眾而以寧」正與鼎銘「毋眾而囂」相對，可證「毋眾而囂」表示不要聚眾喧嘩。《左傳．成公十六年》：「在陳而囂，合而加囂。」杜預注：「囂，喧嘩也。」

　　又用作姓氏。又用作官名，「莫囂」即「莫敖」，是楚國官名，即司馬(參周世榮)。
humanum_short_description: 「囂」會眾口喧嘩之意，本義是喧嘩。

囂張 [ xiāo zhāng ]: rampant; unbridled; arrogant; aggressive
(Simplified: 嚣)
Chinese Definition:
Chinese: When mouths are around a table, one head is likely to say something controversial and start some hubbub.
Meaning: hubbub
Hanzi: 嚣
Story: What's all the hubbub about? There's four mouths munching away on a head over there!
Kind: traditional

金文從四「 口 」從「 頁 」(象人形而突出頭部)，會眾口喧嘩之意(何琳儀)。《說文》：「囂(嚻)，聲也。气出頭上。从㗊、从頁。頁，首也。𠽸，囂或省。」《廣韻》：「囂，喧也。」《玉篇》：「囂，喧譁也。」 金文用作本義，表示喧嘩。中山王鼎：「毋大而肆，毋富而驕，毋眾而囂」。《禮記．坊記》：「子云：『貧而好樂，富而好禮，眾而以寧者，天下其幾矣。』」「眾而以寧」正與鼎銘「毋眾而囂」相對，可證「毋眾而囂」表示不要聚眾喧嘩。《左傳．成公十六年》：「在陳而囂，合而加囂。」杜預注：「囂，喧嘩也。」 又用作姓氏。又用作官名，「莫囂」即「莫敖」，是楚國官名，即司馬(參周世榮)。

From 㗊, from the page. Page, the first also. 𠽸, clamor or province." "Guangyun": "Crowd, noisy." "Yu Chapter": "Noisy, noisy." Bronze inscription is used as the original meaning to express noise. Zhongshan Wangding: "Do not be big and wanton, not rich but arrogant, not crowded." "Book of Rites. "Fang Ji": "Ziyun: "Poverty but happy, rich and good courtesy, people who are peaceful, the world has its own."" "People and peace" is in contrast to the inscription "No people but arrogant", It can be proved that "rallying without crowds" means not to gather crowds to make noise. "Zuo Zhuan. "Sixteenth Year of Cheng Gong": "In Chen and clamor, together and increase clamor." Du Yinan: "clamor, clamor." Also used as a surname. It is also used as an official name. 囂字的基本解释

囂
xiāo
见“嚣”。

囂字的汉语字典释义

[①]［xiāo］
［《集韻》虚嬌切，平宵，曉。］
亦作“嚻1”。“嚣1”的繁体字。
(1)喧哗。
(2)嚣张；强悍。
(3)夸耀。
(4)轻浮；轻薄。
(5)闲适貌；自得貌。参见“囂然”、“囂囂”。
(6)得意貌。参见“囂然”。
(7)虚空貌。参见“囂囂”。
(8)方言。犹薄。
(9)通“枵”。饥饿。参见“囂然”。
[②]［áo］
［《集韻》牛刀切，平，疑。］
亦作“嚻2”。“嚣2”的繁体字。
(1)傲慢貌。参见“囂2囂”。
(2)忧愁貌；怨愁貌；怨恨貌。参见“囂2然”、“囂2囂”。
(3)谗毁貌。参见“囂2囂”。
(4)山凹之地。
(5)古地名。
(6)水名。
(7)鸟名。
(8)兽名，猴属。

囂字的康熙字典解释

【丑集上】【口字部】　囂； 康熙笔画：21； 页码：页214第32
〔古文〕?【唐韻】許嬌切【集韻】【韻會】虛嬌切【正韻】吁嬌切，?音枵。【說文】聲也，气出頭上。从㗊从頁。頁，首也。【玉篇】喧譁也。【集韻】聲也。【左傳·昭三年】湫隘囂塵。【釋文】囂，許嬌反，一音五高反。【詩·小雅】選徒囂囂。【傳】囂囂，聲也。【釋文】囂，五刀反，亦許驕反。　又【孟子】人知之亦囂囂，人不知亦囂囂。【註】囂囂，自得無欲之貌。　又人名。【史記·黃帝紀】嫘祖生二子，其一曰?囂，是爲靑陽。　又【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】?牛刀切，音敖。義同。【周禮·秋官】銜枚氏掌司囂。【註】察囂譁者。【釋文】囂，五羔反。　又【詩·小雅】讒口囂囂。【箋】囂囂，衆多貌。【釋文】五刀反，韓詩作嗸嗸。【前漢·董仲舒傳】此民之所以囂囂苦不足也。【註】師古曰：與嗸同。　又【詩·小雅】我卽爾謀，聽我囂囂。【傳】囂囂猶嗸嗸也。【釋文】囂，五刀反。　又【字彙】山凹之地曰囂。【梁宣帝七山寺賦】神囂嵒嵒而特立。　又鳥名。【山海經】梁渠之山有鳥，狀如夸父，四翼一目犬尾，名曰囂。　又獸

Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①] [xiāo]
["Ji Yun" Xu Jiao cut, flat night, dawn. ]
Also known as "嚻1". The traditional characters of "Cao1".
(1) Noise.
(2) Arrogant; tough.
(3) Boasting.
(4) Frivolity; frivolity.
(5) Leisurely appearance; contented appearance. See "Xiao Ran" and "Xiao Ran".
(6) Complacent appearance. See "Xiao Ran".
(7) Void appearance. See "clamor".
(8) Dialects. Still thin.
(9) Through "枵". hunger. See "Xiao Ran".
[②] [áo]
["Jiyun" cuts with a sharp knife, flat, suspicious. ]
Also known as "嚻2". The traditional characters of "Xiao 2".
(1) Arrogant appearance. See "Crowd 2 Crowd".
(2) Sad appearance; resentful appearance; resentful appearance. See "Xiao 2 Ran", "Xiao 2 Xiao".
(3) slanderous appearance. See "Crowd 2 Crowd".
(4) The land of the mountain valley.
(5) Ancient place names.
(6) Water name.
(7) The name of the bird.
(8) Animal name, monkey genus.

[Jade articles] Noisy too. 【Ji Yun】Sound also. [Zuo Zhuan·Three Years of Zhao] Qiuai Xiaochen. [Explanation] Shout, Xu Jiao is anti, five high antis. [Poetry·Xiaoya] Choosing disciples and clamoring. [Biography] clamor, sound. [Explanation] clamor, five swords, but also Xu Jiao.　[Mencius] People are clamoring when they know, but they are also clamoring when they don't know. [Note] Shocking, self-satisfied appearance.　Another name. 【Historical Records·Huang Di Ji】Lei ancestor gave birth to two sons. One of them is Qianyang.　 [Ji Yun] [Yun Hui] [Zheng Yun]? Cut with a knife, sound Ao. The same meaning. [Zhou Li·Qiu Guan] The title of Mei clan's chief executive. [Note] Those who observe the clamor. [Explanation] clamor, five lambs against.　[Poetry·Xiaoya] Speaking and clamoring. [J] Shouting, many looks. 【Explanation】Five knives, Han poetry composes 嗸嗸. [Previous Han·Dong Zhongshu Biography] The reason why the people are clamoring and suffering is not enough. [Note] Shi Gu said: Same as 嗸.　[Poetry·Xiaoya] I’m arrogant, listen to my clamor. [Biography] The clamor is still arrogant. [Explanation] clamor, five swords.　[Words] The land of the mountain valley is called clamor. [Liang Xuan Emperor Qishan Temple Fu] Shen Xiaoyan Yanyan and unique.　Also known as the bird name. [Shanhaijing] There are birds in the mountains of Liangqu, which resemble Kuafu, with four wings and a dogtail, and the name is Xiao.　You beast
